div.head: Boundary Dispute between the Tiktaenoi and the Sporenoi

p.seg: A boundary marker found at modern Girey Pazarı Near the village of Karadiğin, now Akdiğin, in the district of Kütahya in Turkey French 1991, 57 s.v. “KÜTAHYA” contra Christol 1982, 24. provides evidence for a boundary dispute between two communities hitherto unlocatable, and may be dated to the latter part of the third century.

div.p: Eioulios Dionysios, a militiis(?), Burton 2000 no. 42 would translate tribunus militum. See Christol 1982 for discussion. according to the order of the most excellent imperial procurator Eioulios Eioulianos who manages the Phrygian and Carian parts of the province, having gone to the places and examined the details, established the boundary, accompanied by the surveyor Ailianos Earinos. Boundary marker of the Tiktaenoi and Sporenoi.
